labels.analysis: The MCP Proxy server enables connection to SSE-based MCP servers. Based on the description, its core functionality appears to be facilitating secure or managed connections to other MCP servers, likely as a proxy or gateway service. The available tool ("Optional Settings" for server access and management) suggests it has administrative features for overseeing server connections.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "API Integration" was chosen because the server acts as a proxy/gateway to connect to MCP servers, resembling middleware that facilitates communication between systems. The secondary label "Security & Authentication" was selected due to the implication of managed server access requiring signing in. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories adequately cover the functionality.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: MCP Proxy
server_info_crawled.author: mcp-proxy
server_info_crawled.overview: Enable connection to SSE-based MCP servers.

tools.name: Optional Settings
tools.description: Access and manage servers by signing in.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/mcp-proxy/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
